intro: Trichocladus ellipticus, commonly known as the elliptic trichocladus, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
